attributes.action: Review the procedures governing impartiality at the BBC
attributes.additional_details:
Reference Rod Liddle's article in the Spectator. 25th March 2017
Link:
https://www.spectator.co.uk/2017/03/what-shocks-me-about-the-bbc-occasionally-it-isnt-biased/
The link explains the bias shown with references.
"The corporation’s prejudices are so obvious as to be blinding – and they obscure its baby steps towards impartiality".
The BBC should represent all the license payers; and not present a bias to the Liberal left.
attributes.background:
Example; 52% of people voted for BREXIT.
Out of 4,275 guests talking about the EU on the Today programme between 2005 and 2015, only 132, or 3.2 per cent, were supporters of the UK’s withdrawal from the EU. [Lord Pearson of Rannoch]. The BBC continues to breach the charter of impartiality.
